intro: Diasperus diffusus, commonly known as the spreading diasperus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, cylindrical stems. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom during the cooler months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Diasperus diffusus is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
